title: How to Heal From Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) | Dr. Victor Carrión

questions.question: What is the relationship between stress levels and performance according to the inverted U-shaped curve?

options.text: High stress always leads to better performance.
Moderate stress can enhance performance while excessive stress can lead to negative outcomes.
Stress has no impact on performance.
Only low stress is beneficial for performance.

questions.explanation: The inverted U-shaped curve shows that moderate stress can enhance performance, while excessive stress can lead to negative outcomes such as PTSD.

questions.question: According to Dr. Victor Carrión, how should PTSD be viewed for effective treatment?

options.text: As a chronic disorder requiring lifelong management.
As a post-traumatic stress injury needing restoration of balance.
As a mental failure that can be ignored.
As a condition that only affects adults.

questions.explanation: Dr. Victor Carrión suggests that PTSD should be viewed as a post-traumatic stress injury, which emphasizes the need for treatment to restore balance.

questions.question: What therapy, developed by Dr. Kion, combines cognitive behavioral techniques with empowerment strategies to help children manage PTSD symptoms?
questions.explanation: Q Centered Therapy, developed by Dr. Kion, is a multimodal approach that combines cognitive behavioral techniques with empowerment strategies for treating PTSD in children.
